parameters.definition: Cooling capacity of a low-powered air conditioner
Electricity usage of a low-powered air conditioner per day
Cooling capacity of a high-powered air conditioner
Electricity usage of a high-powered air conditioner per day
Maximum proportion of low-powered air conditioners
Minimum number of high-powered air conditioners required
Minimum number of housing units to condition

description: A strata-management company is looking into purchasing two types of air conditioners, a low-power and a high-power model. A low-powered air conditioner can cool down \param{LowPowerCapacity} housing units and uses \param{LowPowerElectricity} units of electricity every day. A high-power model can cool down \param{HighPowerCapacity} housing units and uses \param{HighPowerElectricity} units of electricity every day. Since the low-powered model is not good for the aesthetics, the strata decided to limit the number of low-powered models to only \param{MaxLowPowerProportion} and at least \param{MinHighPower} high-powered models must be used. If the apartment needs to condition at least \param{MinHousingUnits} housing units and has \param{TotalElectricity} units of electricity available, how many of each air conditioner should the strata company buy to minimize the total number of air conditioners?
